description: A three-year-old girl has been found after surviving several days alone in an apartment in East Hartford, Connecticut, after her 37-year-old mother, Twanna Toler (pictured), died.
title: Connecticut girl survives in flat after her mom died
title_page: Connecticut girl survives in flat after her mom died | Daily Mail Online
text:
A three-year-old girl has been found after surviving several days alone in an apartment with her dead mother.
The toddler, who has not been identified, managed to stay alive for days by eating cereal off the floor inside the home in East Hartford, Connecticut.
Her mother, 37-year-old Twanna Toler, was found dead in her bed by a social worker who had been called to the apartment after the young girl was absent from childcare for a number of days.
Twanna Toler, 37, was found dead in her apartment. Her three-year-old daughter survived for several days alone inside their home after the death
A three-year-old girl has been found after surviving several days alone in an apartment (pictured) after he mother died
East Hartford Police said an autopsy is currently being carried out on Toler, but added there are so signs of forced entry or any 'immediate evidence a crime took place', NBC News reports.
Police said while investigators do not know exactly when the mom died, it is believed the three-year-old was alone: 'definitely more than a couple of days'.
Toler's social media accounts were filed with photographs of her with her young daughter.
Susan Tash, a woman who lives in the apartment below the young girl, said she was shocked to hear the terrible news.
A care worker who went to the apartment after the young girl was reported to have missed several days of childcare found Toler (pictured) dead in her bed
Police said they did not yet know how long Toler (left) had been dead before she was found in the apartment
'Boy do I regret not going up there,' Tash told the Hartford Courant.
'It's hard to get over that she was up there and that was happening.'
The young girl was taken to the Connecticut Children's Medical Center after being found.
Police said she was slightly dehydrated, but otherwise unharmed.
The toddler managed to stay alive for days by eating cereal off the floor inside the building (pictured) in East Hartford, Connecticut
